formattedAddress: 33 Crosby St, New York, NY 10013, USA
adrFormatAddress: 33 Crosby St, New York, NY 10013, USA

originalText.text: Really great Barber Shop. Really great haircut and shave. I hope to go back again one day and get more stuff done. I was very happy with the service and the barber that cut my hair and did my shave was very very nice.

text.text: Really great Barber Shop. Really great haircut and shave. I hope to go back again one day and get more stuff done. I was very happy with the service and the barber that cut my hair and did my shave was very very nice.

originalText.text:
Been a loyal client here for a long time and wouldn’t recommend it for the amount it costs to come here. Each time I’ve only gotten average service. They’re also unreasonably strict about cancellations/late which sometimes happen due to unforeseen events (work, life) and then turn around and will make you wait 15 mins for your appointment when you are on time. I just wasted $80 on fees because I had a last minute work conflict, I’ve given this salon HUNDREDS of dollars in both haircuts and tips yet they won’t help you out when you have an unforeseen conflict.

The literally only pleasant thing about going here is Emily’s attitude, but is absolutely not worth $85 + tip. Probably won’t come back.

originalText.text: I've gotten great haircuts from them! Emily is the best. I have long hair and have appreciate the care they've taken. The atmosphere is cozy and chill. They also have great products available for purchase. Though it's not that cheap, I do think the prices are good for the area and for quality.

text.text: I've gotten great haircuts from them! Emily is the best. I have long hair and have appreciate the care they've taken. The atmosphere is cozy and chill. They also have great products available for purchase. Though it's not that cheap, I do think the prices are good for the area and for quality.

originalText.text: Great atmosphere and the haircuts I've had here have been all quite good. I used to like coming here also because the place was run well & appointments were kept on time. But I've also had some bad experiences recently with long waiting (even though they text you on the exact time to make sure you're not even 1 min late) & cancelled appointments. I'll likely still use them because they're right next door for me and, as I said, some of the barbers, like Eliran, are great. However, especially for the prices they charge,  the place overall is hit or miss & there are certainly better places with much better service in NYC.

originalText.text: Just had the worst beard trim of my life in the most uncomfortable barber shop chair I’ve ever sat in. I told the receptionist I wanted a beard trim with straight razor shave to clean the lines, face, and neck. She said no problem. Wait 10 minutes for the barber only to find out she doesn’t do straight razor on the neck. I should have left then but didn’t. The next pillow on the chair is too think so my neck was bent backwards the entire time in an uncomfortable position. The barber used a machine only on the neck so of course my lines were not even. In addition, the minor straight razor shave on my face lines was done without shaving cream or even water. Never had a dry shave in my life before. Finally, I was offered a wet towel to “finish the service”, to which I informed that this usually happens first to open the face up before a shave. I guess they don’t know. Told the receptionist most of this, not even an offer to reduce the overpriced trim. Overall never had such a bad beard trim experience in my life!
